data.title: allow running launch configs from the debug console

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
When no debug session is active, the debug console cannot be used for anything (and it prints a warning).
I suggest to allow some minimal commands in this mode. E.g. `debug` and `run`could be used to launch a launch config in debug or run mode.
If additional arguments are added, they would be passed to the launch config.

So for running a specific set of mocha tests, you could say:
```
run tests --grep api
```
"tests" is the name of a launch config.

data.title: CachedData dir won't clean up
data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code - Insiders 1.17.0-insider (f7962f0682a76516df51de4856f8ccc5d8ad578a, 2017-09-20T05:10:59.524Z)
- OS Version: Darwin x64 15.6.0
- Extensions: enabled or disabled, no difference

---

VSCode Insider's `CachedData` dir won't clean up on my MacOS (it takes 2 GB, some files are from February this year). It should be kept only for 1 week, according to [nodeCachedDataManager.ts](https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/blob/master/src/vs/workbench/electron-browser/nodeCachedDataManager.ts#L21-L23). 

Launching from command line with --verbose doesn't report anything. Is there a way to see the telemetry, or how to debug that file during the startup?

data.title: Feature Request : Syntax highlighting for the CYPHER query language
Quick pick doesn't allow to define stable groups

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
Currently groups are defined by adding a separator to an item. However when the item gets filtered the group disappears. We should instead do the following:

- Have a special separator item
- Only filter the separator item if the group gets empty
- Don't render a border if the first item is a separator

data.title: Support Jupyter Notebook Interactive Computing paradigm
data.body:
Around 500,000 VSCode users have been relying on Don Jayamanne has "vscodeJupyter" extension to connect to Jupyter Notebooks and execute code in an interactive environment.  (https://github.com/DonJayamanne/vscodeJupyter)

With rapid continuing growth of Python, Data Science, and Deep Learning communities, Jupyter Notebooks and interactive computing need to be promoted to a first class citizen of VS Code, rather than being an extension developed by a volunteer.  

Please refer to Atom + Hydrogen integration, and upcoming JupyerLab projects for ideas on how to integrate Notebooks inside Visual Studio Code.

Thank you!

data.title: Explorer should load root folders (workspace folders) sequentially
data.body: Today the explorer is empty until *all* root folders are resolved. In case of a remote file system, that can be a long time. Instead it should show the roots as given and the loading indication individually for them. Also, failure of one should "break" the explorer

data.title: Add context information when making signature help requests
data.body: This is the other half of https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/issues/752

data.title: Emmet should use embeddedLanguage to determine if in css
data.body:
**Problem**
For css within js/ts strings, emmet css expansions are currently not enabled:

```js
styled.button`
    color: red;
    m10|
`
```

The js document in this case is using the `html` emmet syntax profile. However the string contents are marked as `css` in VS Code  and it looks like emmet does not honor this language setting. Only html emmet expansions are enabled inside of the template string

**Proposal**
When using the `html` syntax profile, emmet should look at the language mode of the current context to determine if we are in a style sheet. Currently this is determined by looking for a `<style>` tag, which will not exist for cases like the above

- OS Version: Linux x64 4.12.13-300.fc26.x86_64
- Extensions: 

Extension|Author (truncated)|Version
---|---|---
language-x86-64-assembly|13x|2.2.11
vscode-docker|Pet|0.0.18
code-gnu-global|aus|0.2.2
file-templates|brp|1.2.0
FreeMarker|dco|0.0.9
python|don|0.7.0

csharp|ms-|1.12.1

java|red|0.10.0
html-preview-vscode|tht|0.1.1
vim|vsc|0.10.1
jinja|who|0.0.8



---

A background process `/usr/share/code/code /usr/share/code/resources/app/out/bootstrap --type=searchService` always takes a whole CPU core.

Steps to Reproduce:

1. open a node project created by vue-cli
2. one `Code` process takes a whole CPU core and creates six subprocesses running `find -L . -type f`
3. after closing the Code, these subprocesses take all my four CPU cores for about one minute before exit

<!-- Launch with `code --disable-extensions` to check. -->
Reproduces without extensions: No

data.title: CSS and SCSS indentation using tabs is off with lines with the color decorator
data.body:
<!-- Use Help > Report Issues to prefill these. -->
- VSCode Version: 1.16.1
- OS Version: Ubuntu Linux 16.04 Gnome

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Start a blank file `/tmp/foo.css/`
2. Paste this code in there:

```css
/* I've intentionally indented with 2 spaces */
.foo {
  padding: 10px;
  color: #123;
}
```

3. Go to the bottom right and click the tab size box and select "Convert indentation to Tabs".
4. The `color` line has slightly different indentation.

<!-- Launch with `code --disable-extensions` to check. -->
Reproduces without extensions: Yes

Here's a screenshot with `code --disable-extensions`:

![foo css_023](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/314/30672400-29ba5e38-9e3a-11e7-9395-ed8e3cbac4ec.png)

Believe me, I prefer spaces for indentation, but I'm on a couple code bases where the team has chosen tabs. And this is a weird annoyance. 

This goes away if I set: `"editor.colorDecorators": false` in the settings.

data.title: Light bulb for code actions displays only when text is selected
data.body:
<!-- Do you have a question? Please ask it on http://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/vscode. -->

<!-- Use Help > Report Issues to prefill these. -->
- VSCode Version: 1.16
- OS Version: macOS

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Place cursor within range where a "hint" diagnostic exists.

Light bulb should appear in left margin, but it no longer does. Instead, you need to select at least one character in the range. This worked correctly by simply placing the cursor in the range without selection in previous versions of VSCode.

This makes code actions more difficult to discover. Users need to guess where they might exist. Please return to previous behavior.
